content.description: Chandler’s bedroom, he is giving Monica a massage.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I can’t believe we’ve never done this before! It’s sooo good! So good for Monica!
(Chandler picks up the timer being used and turns it to zero at which it chimes.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh! Look at that, time’s up! My turn!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That was a half an hour?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s your timer.
(They change places.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, I don’t like to brag about it, but I give the best massages!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right, then massage me up right nice!
(She starts the massage, only she is doing extremely hard and Chandler is gasping in pain.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ah! Ahh!! Ahh!!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s so good, isn’t it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s so good I don’t know what I’ve done to deserve it!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Say good-bye to sore muscles!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good-bye muscles!!

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the couch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m telling you, she gives the worst massages ever!! Okay, it was like she was torturing me for information. And I wanted to give it up I just—I didn’t know what it was!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, if it really hurts that bad you should just tell her.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, for the first time in my life I’m in a real relationship. Okay, I’m not gonna screw that up by y’know, telling the truth.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey.
content.parenthetical: walking up with Rachel and carrying coffee

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Whoa, dude, look out! You almost crushed my hat! (He picks a hat up from the floor. It’s one of those magician stovepipe hats.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And the bunny got away. (Turns and starts looking for the bunny as Joey puts the hat on.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This would be the place where you explain the hat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh! Yeah, look there’s this play all right? And I’m up for the part of this real cool like suave international guy. A real clothes horse. So I figure that everyone at the audition is gonna be wearing this kinda y’know, ultra-hip, high fashion stuff.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And you’re gonna make them all disappear.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, like you could find something as sophisticated as this.
(Chandler picks up a basket from the table and puts it on his head.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Done.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, if you wanna look good, why don’t you just come down to the store? I’ll help you out.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Great! Thanks, Rach!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sure! (Pause) God, please take those off!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right.
(Both of them remove their hats as Phoebe enters.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey Pheebs, how’s it going?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! Umm, well, only okay because I just got back from, from the hospital.
(All at once.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Is everything okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Are you all right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yeah, no-no-no. I’m fine. I’m okay, but umm, my Grandma sorta died.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs! Sorry!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s okay, I mean she had a really incredible life. And it’s not like I’m never gonna see her again, y’know she’s gonna visit.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well maybe, maybe she’s with us right now?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, her first day on a new spiritual plane and she’s gonna come to the coffeehouse!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Guys! Guys! I just saw two people having sex in a car right outside.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uhh, Pheebs’ Grandmother just died.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Ohh my God, I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s okay. Actually y’know what, it’s kinda cool. ’Cause it’s like y’know, one life ends and another begins.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not the way they’re doing it. What, what happened? How did she die?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well umm, okay we were in the market and she bent down to get some yogurt and she just never came back up again.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Pheebs, I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It was really sweet. The last thing she said to me was; “Okay dear, you go get the eggs and I’m gonna get the yogurt and we’ll meet at the checkout counter.” And y’know what? We will meet at the checkout counter.

content.description: [Scene: Bloomingdale’s, Rachel is fixing Joey up with some new clothes.]

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay now Joey, y’know that since you’re returning all of this stuff right after the audition you’re gonna have to wear underwear?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, then you’d better show me some of that too then.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, it’s missing something. Ooh, I know! Umm, okay. (Goes and grabs a bag, that looks like a purse, and shows it to Joey.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Really? A purse?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s not a purse! It’s a shoulder bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: It looks like a women’s purse.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No Joey, look. Trust me, all the men are wearing them in the spring catalog. Look. (Shows him.) See look, men , carrying the bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See look, women , carrying the bag. (He puts it on his shoulder and looks at himself in the mirror and likes what he sees.) But it is odd how a women’s purse looks good on me, a man.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Exactly! Unisex!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe you need sex. I had sex a couple days ago.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No! No Joey! U-N-I-sex.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, I ain’t gonna say no to that.

content.description: Ursula’s apartment, Phoebe is about to break the bad news to her sister. She knocks on the door.

content.text: Ursula: Who is it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: It’s Phoebe.
Ursula: Oh great! (Opens the door.) (Disappointed) Oh, you. Umm, what’s up?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, well I sorta have some bad news, can I come in?
Ursula: Umm, yeah—no thanks.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, well, umm Grandma died.
Ursula: Wow! Didn’t she die like five years ago?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, she just died today! Okay, umm, we’re having a memorial service tomorrow.
Ursula: Okay, I know that I went to that all ready.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No you didn’t!
Ursula: Well, then who’s been dead for five years?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, lots of people! Look, are you coming to memorial service or not?
Ursula: Umm, no. See I already thought she was dead so I kinda made my peace with it. Plus, I’m going to a concert tomorrow. So… I’d invite you, but umm, I only have two tickets left.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Fine. Okay, enjoy your concert. (Starts to leave.)
Ursula: Thanks! Enjoy your funeral.

content.description: Central Perk, Ross and Chandler are on the couch as Joey enters with his new bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey!
(As he walks past both Chandler and Ross notice the bag and stare at each other in shock.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wow! You look just like your son Mrs. Tribbiani!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What? Are you referring to my man’s bag? At first, I thought it just looked good, but it’s practical too. Check it out! It’s got compartments for all your stuff! Your wallet! Your keys! Your address book!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Your make-up!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, what are you doing with the bag? You’re audition is not until tomorrow.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, but sandwich time is right now. (Removes a sandwich and starts eating.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, y’know you get any mustard on that bag, you can’t return it.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why would I return it? I love this bag!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, then you owe me $350.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Fine! Do you take Vasa or Mustercard? (He’s holding the fake credit cards that come with the bag.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey…

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right relax, look I’ll pay you with the money from the acting job I am definitely gonna get thanks to you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What’s the part, Anti-man?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, don’t listen to them. I think it’s sexy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: U-N-I-sexy? (Smiles provocatively.)

content.description: Phoebe’s Grandmother’s memorial, Phoebe is at the door welcoming people.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well hello, Mrs. Penella! Thank you so much for coming! Well, okay look, here’s your umm, 3-D glasses and Reverend Pong will tell you when to put them on.
(The gang arrives.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi sweetie!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, how are you holding up?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Pheebs, I’m so sorry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, y’know what? My Grandma had the exact same bag!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Here, I brought you some flowers. (He pulls them out of the bag.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Thanks!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pulling flowers out it makes the bag look a lot more masculine.
(Another man, an older man, enters, looking around and bumps into Chandler.)

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Oops, I’m sorry. Excuse me. Is this the umm, the memorial?
(The gang moves off as Phoebe greets the new guest.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, welcome.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Hello. Hello.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm here’s your 3-D glasses.

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Oh, umm, all right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So how did you know Francis?

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Well I actually, I-I really, I haven’t seen her for years. But umm, well I-I was pretty tight with-with her and her daughter.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?! What’s your name?

content.speaker: Man
content.text: Umm, Frank Buffay.
(Needless to say, Phoebe is stunned into silence. And one audience member gasps.)

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Y’know what? Strike that. My name uh, actually is-is Joe. Uh, Joe umm, Hill.
content.parenthetical: Seeing the look on her face

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You’re Frank Buffay?

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Shh! (Whispers) No! Joe Hill!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You just said…

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Y’know what, I gotta go. And thank you so much for coming. (Hands back his glasses and hurries out.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But…
(Phoebe takes one step after him and stops.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?! What honey?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What happened?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That was my dad!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!
(They all look down the hall he left from.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey you guys, check it out. Check it out. (Moves his hand towards and away from his face.) It’s like it’s coming right at me. (Chandler helps out a little bit by pushing on Joey’s arm, which causes his hand to slap him in his face.)

content.description: The Funeral Home, continued from earlier. Phoebe is returning after looking for her father.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, did you catch him?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wh-what did he say?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He said, “Nice to meet you Glenda.” (They stare at her, dumbfounded) Well, obviously I couldn’t give him my real name?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why?! Why not?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come on, you saw the way he ran out of here! What do you think? He’s gonna stick around and talk to the daughter he abandoned!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What did you say to him?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I said, I told him y’know, that I was the executor person of Francis’ will and that I needed to talk to him so I’m gonna meet him at the coffee house later.

content.speaker: The Pastor
content.text: Could everyone please take their seats?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, well, I just can’t think about that right now. I just wanna say good-bye to my Grandma.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: All right, let’s go say good-bye.
(They put on their glasses and try to find their way to their seats.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, after the funeral, everyone is there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! I’m off to my audition. How do I look?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahhh, I think you look great ! That bag is gonna get you that part.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And a date with a man!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what? Make fun all you want. This is a great bag! Okay? And it’s as handy as it is becoming. Now, just because you don’t understand something, doesn’t make it wrong. All right? So from now on you guys are gonna have to get used to the fact that Joey, (pats the bag) comes with a bag! (Exits.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right, I’d better go too. I have to go talk to my dad.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ooh, Pheebs, what are you gonna say? Are you gonna tell him who you are?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, no, not at first ’cause I-I don’t want to freak him out

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, but aren’t you pissed at him?! I mean this guy abandoned you! I gotta tell you if this were me, this guy would be in some serious physical danger! (Getting worked up) I mean I-I-I’d walk in there and I’d be like, “Yo, dad! You and me outside right now!” (Calming down.) I kinda scared myself.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, at least you scared someone.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know it’s funny, you’d think I’d be angry. I mean, you’d think I’d wanna rip his tiny little head off. Fortunately, I’m past it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Phoebe, you do seem a little tense. Here, let me help you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right.
(She goes over and tries to give Phoebe a massage. Phoebe yelps in pain and jumps away from her.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Get off!! Ow!! Oh, stop it!! Why?! Why are you doing that to me?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: As a masseuse and a human, I’m begging you, never do that to anyone!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I give good massages! (Ross laughs.) I used to give them to Rachel all the time before she got allergic! And-and-and Chandler loves them! Watch! (She starts giving Chandler a massage.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: He-he does not like it! He hates it! He’s in pain!
content.parenthetical: seeing the look on Chandler’s face

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No he’s not!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, he is!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry but, ow-owww-owww!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’ve been lying to me? I can’t believe you’d do that.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, maybe he just didn’t want to hurt your feelings.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: But the minute we start to lie to each other… (Pauses after she realizes what she’s saying.) And by ‘we’ I mean society.

content.description: Joey’s audition, he is with bag.

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Any time you’re ready, Joey.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, you must be new here. Why don’t we get a table and I’ll buy you a drink.

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: I’m sorry. Could you, could you try it without the purse?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, sure. (He takes it off and starts reading.) Well, you must be new here. Maybe we should—I’m sorry, can I ask you something? (He stops and asks a question.)

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Sure. What?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, first it’s not a purse.

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Okay, anytime.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I mean if-if you’re thinking it’s a woman’s bag, it’s not. It’s a man’s bag!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Okayyyy! Anddd, go!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right look, let me show you the catalog! (Does so.) See? Huh? It’s the latest thing! Everyone’s got one! Men! Women! Children! Everyone’s carrying them!

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Umm, do you sell these bags?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Noooo. No-no-no, these babies sell themselves.

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: Okay! Thank you! That was great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah but I didn’t read anything.

content.speaker: The Casting Director
content.text: I think we’ve seen enough!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay! All right, I’ll see ya. (As he’s walking off stage.) (Patting the bag.) We got it! We got it!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler is poking his head in.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, is Rachel here?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Listen, I just wanted to apologize about this afternoon and the whole massage thing. Y’know? I-I really like ’em.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, please, stop! Look, we’re supposed to be honest with each other. I-I just wish you could tell me—just say, “I don’t like your massages.”

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I don’t like your massages.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: See? It’s no big deal.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, but now see you’re crying!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m not crying about that! I’m crying about something that happened at work.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My boyfriend said he didn’t like my massages.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s okay, you don’t have to be the best at everything.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! You don’t know me at all!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, you give the worst massages in the world.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m crying here!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, hear me out. Okay? You give the best bad massages. If anybody was looking for the best bad massage and they were thinking to themselves, “Who’s the best of that?” They’d have to go to you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh. So you’re saying like umm, if there was an award for the best bad massage, well who would get that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, it would be you! You! Monica! And you’d get all the votes!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So maybe they could umm, call the award the Monica?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Absolutely!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. I suck!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah! (They hug.)

content.description: Central Perk, Frank Sr. is just arriving.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Umm, thank you for meeting with me.

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Thank you. All right.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Come, sit. (He’s hesitant.) Sit. (Still hesitating.) Sit! (He sits on the arm of the couch.) Umm, all righty, before we get started I just—I need you to state for the official record that you are in fact Frank Buffay.

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Oh yes. Yes, yes, I am, uh-hmm.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: So, what did Francis leave me?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Huh?

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Well, that’s why you wanted me to come, right?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh yes. Yes. Yeah—no. She did. She left you umm, (looking in her purse) this lipstick.

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Oh. Huh. It’s huh, well it’s (opens it) oh it’s—ew used. Umm, cool.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay. I have just a few questions to ask so I’m going to get out my official forms. (She picks up a couple of crumpled receipts.) Okay, so, question 1) You and uh, you were married to Francis’ daughter Lilly, is that correct?

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Yes, yes I was.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, umm, question 2) Umm, did that marriage end A. Happily, B. Medium, or C. In the total abandonment of her and her two children?

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: It really says that?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. See? (Quickly shows him.)

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Well then I guess then I-I would I would have to say C.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hmm, okay, total abandonment. Okay, reasons for abandonment, A. Top secret government work, B. Amnesia, or C. Or you’re just a selfish, irresponsible bad, bad man?

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Y’know, I don’t think I want the lipstick that much. (Gets up to leave.) But umm… Oh, would you do me a favor? And umm, would you, would you give Lilly that, please? (Hands her a note.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Well Lilly, when you see Lilly would you give her that, that note? Because I wanted to talk to her at the memorial but, well I pictured her getting mad at me the way you got mad at me and I well, I chickened out. So, uh, I wrote her that note, would you give it to her please?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: But you-you-you came to see Lilly?

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Yeah, yeah. Why?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Lilly’s dead. (He looks up in shock.)

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: She what?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: She’s dead.

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Are you sure?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, if she isn’t then cremating her was a big mistake.

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: I can’t believe this. I just—I can’t believe this. How-how—Oh my God. How long ago?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: 17 years ago.

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Oh! What about, what about the girls?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, Ursula is a waitress and-and she lives in Soho. And Phoebe, (pause) is on this couch.
(Silence ensues.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yep, lipstick and a daughter, big day for you!

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Phoebe, I-I-I-umm, (Sits down next to her and brushes against her leg.) Oops. (He backs up.) I just, I-I-I-I don’t, I don’t know what to say. I just can’t believe that you’re my daughter, you’re so pretty.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes. Well, that’s neither here nor there.

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: So would it, would it make you feel better if I said I was very, very sorry that I left?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Y’know what, it doesn’t matter what you say it’s not gonna make a difference anyway, so you can just go.

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: All right. Well, y’know in my defense I was a lousy father.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s a defense?

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Yes. Yes it is. I burned the formula and I put your diapers on backwards. I mean, I made up a song to sing you to sleep, but that made you cry even more!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You make up songs?

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: Well no, just-just that one. But, it was stupid. Let’s see, how did it, how did it go. Umm. (Singing.)
Sleepy girl, sleepy girl. Why won’t you go to sleep? Sleepy girl, sleepy girl. You’re, you’re, you’re keeping me uppp! (Yeah, that’s to the tune of Smelly Cat.)
Yeah.
(Phoebe is trying not to smile. He moves closer and very shyly holds out his hand and turns his head, hoping for Phoebe to take his hand. She doesn’t.)

content.speaker: Frank Sr.
content.text: I just, I y’know, I’m not very good at this. So, umm… (Backs away.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I am. (Moves over and takes his hand.)
(She holds his hand for a little while then…)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not yet, no. (Drops his hand and moves back.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Joey returns from his audition and finds everyone but Phoebe there.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey man, how did the audition go?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Estelle said I didn’t get it. (Sits down next to Rachel on the couch.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?! Why? Joey you were so ready for it!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, I thought so too but, she said the casting people had some problems with me.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What kind of problem?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well to tell you the truth, they uh, (Pause) they had a problem with the bag!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh my God!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Nooooo!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know what? It was a stupid play anyway!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know, Joey, I think it’s time to give up the bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t wanna give up the bag. I don’t have to give up the bag! Do I Rach? (She’s avoiding his eyes.) Oh, you think I should give up the bag!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey wait, Joey, I’m sorry I mean as terrific as I think you are with it… (Looks for help.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, hey! (Ross nods in agreement as well.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: …I just don’t know if the world is ready for you and your bag.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I can’t believe I’m hearing this!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! I’m not saying that you shouldn’t have a bag, I just—it’s just there are other bags that are a little less umm, (Pause) controversial.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah umm, they’re called wallets.
